snippet.title: Pi Does Not Power On
snippet.summary: Verify the power adapter and cable before inspecting the board.
snippet.body: Use a 5V/2.5A power supply and a known-good cable. Inspect the board for damage and ensure the SD card is seated fully.

steps.step: Disconnect power and re-seat the microSD card.
Reconnect power using a certified 5V/2.5A adapter.
Check that the red PWR LED is solid and the green ACT LED blinks.

snippet.tip: Loose USB peripherals can short the board—unplug extras while testing.

snippet.title: No Display Output
snippet.summary: Confirm HDMI selection and safe-mode boot.
snippet.body: Ensure the HDMI cable is connected to HDMI0 and the monitor input is correct. Enable HDMI safe mode if the display stays blank.

steps.step: Power off the Pi and connect only the display and power.
Edit config.txt to add the line: hdmi_safe=1.
Boot and wait 30 seconds for the display handshake.
